reporter_caption.center: GLASCO ELECTRIC COMPANY v. WIEDEFELD, 858 S.W.2d 288 (Mo.App.E.D. 1993)

caption.center: GLASCO ELECTRIC COMPANY, A CORPORATION, PLAINTIFF/APPELLANT, v. WAYNE

court.center: Missouri Court of Appeals, Eastern District,

opinion.posture: APPEAL FROM THE CIRCUIT COURT, ST. FRANCOIS COUNTY; JAMES E. PENNOYER, JUDGE.
opinion.attorneys:
Garry Seltzer, Clayton, for plaintiff, appellant.
Walter S. Drusch, Lowes Drusch, Cape Girardeau, for defendants, respondents.
opinion.panel: Before CRANDALL, P.J., and PUDLOWSKI and GRIMM, JJ.
opinion.opinion_text:
[1] Supplier appeals the trial court's refusal to enforce a mechanic's lien.
[2] An opinion reciting the detailed facts and restating the principles of law would have no precedential value. However, the parties have been furnished with a memorandum opinion for their information only, setting forth the facts and reasons for this order.
[3] The judgment is affirmed in accordance with Rule 84.16(b).
